Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2007 08:18PM - edited Oct 18, 2007 08:19PM by Momrita I would get those nodules checked out right now.  May 2006 my moms oncologist told us everyone has lung nodule, do not worry she had a mastectomy- triple negative, no nodes and chemo.  .  As of September 7th she has more nodules in lungs, metastisis to brain, bones, liver, kidney and pancreas.  SHe has less than six months to live.  Should we have gotten the lung nodule checked out you bet.  Also tumor markers at the start of this September bad news were normal

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2007 06:18PM Momrita wrote: I am very sorry to hear about Diane, my Mom died in November and I have been keeping an eye on your story, and was hopeing for a miracle for you.  You had a very special marriage, one that most people will never experience.  MY prayers are with you and your family this holiday season, and for all the strong ladies that have been taken away from us to early.

Posts.Content: Momrita wrote: My Mom died today, after a 2 month battle, with metatastic breast cancer that came back to her brain, bones, lungs pancreas, kidneys and liver.  And to think 18 months ago she was a triple negative, mastectomy with no lymph nodes involved, and had done chemo.  What a roller coaster it has been, she never got her strength back after her latest chemo and radiation over the past several weeks.  Good luck to all you ladies and keep up the fight. Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2007 10:26PM Momrita wrote: My Mom is in the hospital due to lung issues, from her lung metastitis, she also recieved the news it is in her liver kidneys and pancreas and bones and brain.  She went in last week as a e/r patient she was so wobbely after radiation and chemo she is now starting on Taxetere.  They thought maybe the fluid was  around her heart she was  ult4rasounded for heart  and  lungs and now they think it might be just a upper resportory virus.  Who knows.  She just had her second Taxotere and she will stay in the hospital over the to make sure she has no problems over the weekend and she is well cared for there
